metadata.name: Lost in the Noise
metadata.description:
Do you ever feel lost in all this noise? That you’re screaming into the void and nothing is being heard?

We all get those feelings now, don’t we? I know I do. 
But on a cold winter evening, in a small mountain town, amongst the fog, it feels like bliss. That no one can hear me, no one can see, I am invisible in the faint horn of a car coming around, or the old dog sniffing around for some nibbles, or that big vapor light shining through the mist. That feels peaceful and it feels……. Quiet.  
So, I bring this piece to you, as a gentle reminder to myself to seek out these moments, where it’s bliss to stay lost, in this rat race of standing out of the noise.

I bring you, Lost in the Noise.

Artist: Bondhu Dey  
Medium: Photography

attributes.value: ISO: 1250  Focal length: 55mm  Aperture: f/5.6  Shutter: 1/20s
